RED.title: Introduction to Real Estate
RED.description: Basic understanding of the real estate industry, the process of real estate development and investment, and the key players involved.

RED.title: Real Estate Career Seminar
RED.description: Career assessment and preparation; real estate industry overview; reflection on experiences.

RED.title: Real Estate Internship Seminar
RED.description: Real estate development skills for practice; internship seminar; leadership, group dynamics and presentation skills; application of management; organizational diversity; reflection on experiences.

RED.title: Introduction to Finance in Cities
RED.description: Basic understanding of public finance, public debt, public-private joint ventures, time value of money, present value, risk and return, discounted cash flows, leverage and taxes.

RED.title: Land Use Regulation
RED.description: Land use planning and zoning; community and government relations; environmental regulation.

RED.title: Real Estate Development Fundamentals
RED.description: Real estate overview; evolution of cities and neighborhoods; product types; introduction to valuation.

RED.title: Real Estate Development Analysis
RED.description: Real estate development feasibility and analysis; underwriting local fundamentals including neighborhood and city change, real estate capital flows.

RED.title: Residential Properties
RED.description: Cities and urban form created through various real estate product types. Case studies and site visits.

RED.title: History of Planning and Development
RED.description: Historical evolution of planning and development. How changing modes of planning and development have shaped the built landscape throughout the century.

RED.title: Designing Livable Communities
RED.description: Theories and concepts of livable communities and good city form; case studies of historical and current best practices; field visits; collaborative design project.

RED.title: Analyzing Real Estate Markets
RED.description: Macro and micro-analysis of urban property markets; demographics; location choice; regulation

RED.title: Advanced Finance and Investment for Real Estate  Development
RED.description: Advanced real estate principles. Underwriting property valuation and deal structure including risk and return. Debt and equity markets; difference between development and existing assets.

RED.title: Directed Research
RED.description: Individual research and readings.

RED.title: Market Analysis for Real Estate
RED.description: Explores macro and micro aspects of residential, retail, office,  and industrial markets and examines methodologies for analyzing  such markets for real estate development/investment purposes.

RED.title: Real Estate Practice and Principles
RED.description: Fundamental principles of real estate analysis; economics; capital markets; development decision making; relationships between real estate markets and federal, state and local government policies; property value.

RED.title: Finance of Real Estate Development
RED.description: Theory and methods of real estate finance and investment. Real estate investment analysis, real estate entities, taxation; introduction to securization of real estate equities, debt.

RED.title: Real Estate Capital Markets
RED.description: Explore structure, instruments and institutions of real estate  capital markets.  Consider linkages between real estate and  capital markets.  Asses role of Real Estate Investment Trusts.

RED.title: Legal Issues in Real Estate Development
RED.description: Ownership and transfer of real estate; formation and enforcement  of contracts; business associations; environmental regulation;  taxation of property transfers; acquiring, financing, leasing of  commercial property.

RED.title: Introduction to the Asset Management of Real Estate
RED.description: Overview of institutional asset management: creating and  implementing investment and portfolio strategies through the  development, acquisition, underwriting, and operational stages of  the investment, asset disposition.

RED.title: Building Typologies
RED.description: The exploration of categories of building types, including retail, industrial, residential, office, and institutional, using key examples or case studies from each.

RED.title: Directed Research
RED.description: Research leading to the master's degree. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

RED.title: Office and Industrial
RED.description: An evaluation of various real estate development product types. Case studies and site visits.

UGST.title: First Year Transition and Success
UGST.description: Addresses first-year academic exploration at USC and covers student success practices. Includes instructor lectures and faculty/staff presentations on academic exploration, strengths development, mindset, resilience, grit, study strategies, time management, campus resources, careers and high-impact practices.

UGST.title: President's High-Tech Scholars Student Success
UGST.description: Two-semester course for President's High-Tech Scholars. First semester: university success skills. Second semester: career/grad school preparation. Includes networking and professional development.

UGST.title: President's High-Tech Scholars Student Success
UGST.description: Two-semester course for President's High-Tech Scholars. First semester: university success skills. Second semester: career/grad school preparation. Includes networking and professional development.

SWKO.title: Human Behavior and the Social Environment
SWKO.description: The person-in-environment, bio-psycho-social perspective is the lens through which theories of personality, family, group, organization, community, culture and their interactions are explored. (Duplicates credit in SOWK 503 and SOWK 505)

SWKO.title: Professional Self-Care in Integrative Social Work Practice
SWKO.description: Focuses on the value, examination and integration of professional self-care, wellness and resilience strategies into ethical and professional integrative social work practice.

SWKO.title: Critical Decision Making in Integrative Social Work Practice
SWKO.description: Focuses on the value and application of critical thinking and decision-making into ethical and professional integrative social work practice.

SWKO.title: Foundations of Integrative Social Work Practice I
SWKO.description: Principles underlying social work practice with emphasis on rapport building, engagement, assessment and contracting individuals, families and groups though a social change framework.

SWKO.title: Foundations of Integrative Social Work Practice II
SWKO.description: Principles underlying social work practice with emphasis on intervention, termination and evaluation with individuals, families and groups though a social change framework.

SWKO.title: Policy and Advocacy in Professional Social Work
SWKO.description: A study of the complex and interconnecting systems of policy, programs and communities that directly and indirectly impact Social Workers' clients lives. (Duplicates credit in SOWK 534)

SWKO.title: Science of Social Work
SWKO.description: Introduction to the role of scientific inquiry in advancing social work goals. Inspires students to include science in their social work identity and professional decision-making. (Duplicates credit in SOWK 562)

SWKO.title: Applied Learning in Practicum Education I
SWKO.description: Supervised beginning generalist practicum seminar and placement to develop practice skills in working with individuals, families, groups, communities and/or organizations.

SWKO.title: Applied Learning in Practicum Education II
SWKO.description: Supervised generalist master's level practicum seminar and placement to develop practice skills in working with individuals, families, groups, communities and/or organizations.

SWKO.title: Research and Evaluation in Integrative Social Work Practice
SWKO.description: Critical analysis and application of empirical evidence and research methods to assess client strengths and needs and to evaluate and improve integrative social work practice.

SWKO.title: Social Work in Schools: Interventions Across Developmental S
SWKO.description: Practice with children and families from birth through adolescence. The ecological perspective, typical development, assessment, engagement and intervention in schools are core components.

SWKO.title: Assessment and Diagnosis of Mental Disorders
SWKO.description: Assessment of mental disorders, and the rationale and organization of the system for diagnosis. Emphasis is on developing differential diagnostic skills.

SWKO.title: Brief Therapy and Crisis Intervention
SWKO.description: Theory and multimodal approaches for brief therapy and crisis intervention with a broad spectrum of clients in a range of mental health and health settings.

SWKO.title: Substance Related and Behavioral Addictive Disorders and Rec
SWKO.description: Causal exploration of substance related and behavioral addictive disorders. Evidence-based and practice informed treatment models for vulnerable individuals, groups and families.

SWKO.title: Practice and Policy with Children and Families  Across Settings
SWKO.description: Provides context and preparation for integrative social work practitioners on organizational and policy practice, and leadership in communities and systems serving children, youth and families.

SWKO.title: Self-Awareness and Intercultural Humility in  Social Work
SWKO.description: Critical exploration of sociocultural context and one's own  values/assumptions/biases to enhance intercultural humility in  social work.

SWKO.title: Policy Advocacy and Social Change
SWKO.description: Analysis of efforts to improve local human services organizations and agencies with consideration of political, social, demographic and organization contexts. Prerequisite: SOWK 506, SOWK 536, SOWK 544, SOWK 546.

SWKO.title: Integrative Interventions with Children, Youth and Families
SWKO.description: Assessment and evidence-based intervention in integrative practice with children, youth and families.

SWKO.title: Advanced Practice in Integrated Health and Mental Health
SWKO.description: Advanced micro, mezzo and macro practice skills for the implementation of interventions in integrated, health and mental health care settings with individuals, families and groups.

SWKO.title: Advanced Integrative Social Work Practice with Complex Cases
SWKO.description: Advances knowledge and skills of integrative social work using cultural and justice oriented practice for complex adult, family, group, organization and community circumstances.

SWKO.title: Grant Writing and Program Development for Social Workers
SWKO.description: Grant writing and program development that are generalized to any settings and relevant to direct and macro social work practice expertise.

SWKO.title: Mental Health Assessment and Diagnosis of Children and Adole
SWKO.description: Mental health assessment and diagnosis of children and adolescents. Course includes relevant diagnoses and the systematic or societal challenges that impact mental health of youth.

SWKO.title: Integrative Practice in Military and Veteran Social Work I
SWKO.description: Advanced integrative social work practice knowledge and skills for understanding theories, policies and engaging with military-affiliated populations, including children, adults, families, organizations and constituencies.

SWKO.title: Applied Learning In Practicum Education III
SWKO.description: Supervised practicum seminar and placement to develop practice skills in working with individuals, families, groups, communities and/or organizations.

SWKO.title: Loss, Grief and Bereavement
SWKO.description: Focus on the experiences of loss, death and bereavement as it is viewed by individuals, families and loved ones.

SWKO.title: Applied Learning in Practicum Education IV
SWKO.description: Supervised practicum seminar and placement to develop practice skills in working with individuals, families, groups, communities and/or organizations.

SWKO.title: Complex Social Problems
SWKO.description: Emphasizes leadership in addressing systemic social challenges.

SWKO.title: Leadership and Strategic Communication for Stakeholder Engag
SWKO.description: Leading public discourse for the purposes of increasing civic engagement and public participation, building broad based public support and enabling competencies.

SWKO.title: Leadership for Intervention Implementation in Complex System
SWKO.description: Examining large scale national, state and local intervention programs as well as modeling potential organizational redesign to improve service delivery strategies.

SWKO.title: Financial Management for Social Change
SWKO.description: Senior financial management and planning in human service organizations, emphasizing fiscal approaches that focus on strategy, including how to maximize revenue, control costs, allocate resources, improve decision-making and support successful social programs and disruptive social change.

SWKO.title: Design Laboratory for Social Innovation I
SWKO.description: Incorporates leadership in intervention design, stakeholder engagement, and evidence-based practices.

SWKO.title: Research Methods for Intervention Design and Evaluation
SWKO.description: Introduction to doctoral level research and evaluation, introducing concepts of effectively using literature, formulating a problem for research and effectively identifying a research or evaluative approach.

SWKO.title: Executive Leadership: Leaders as Maestros
SWKO.description: The Leader/Maestro Concept enlarges the student from a virtuoso perspective - individual performance - to include an organizational performance in leading, creating and measuring change.

SWKO.title: Leadership and Communication for Sustaining Interventions
SWKO.description: Explores how communication and new information technology influence decision-makers and the general public to address complex challenges in society.

SWKO.title: Data Driven Decision Making in Social Services
SWKO.description: Practical introduction to using quantitative administrative data to identify trends, track performance, evaluate programs and drive decision making.

SWKO.title: Design Laboratory for Social Innovation II
SWKO.description: Emphasizes leadership in developing responsive interventions to address complex social problems.

SWKO.title: Preparatory Scholarship for Capstone
SWKO.description: Design and develop an innovative, feasible, and defensible Capstone Project focusing on a selected Grand Challenge for Social Work.

SWKO.title: Preparatory Scholarship for Capstone
SWKO.description: Refine a fully implementable, innovatively designed Grand Challenge Capstone Project. Future-focused on garnering support, piloting and launching students' capstone prototype.

SWKO.title: Preparatory Scholarship for Capstone
SWKO.description: Complete a fully implementable, innovatively designed Grand Challenge Capstone Project. Future-focused on garnering support, piloting and launching students' capstone project.

SWKO.title: Research
SWKO.description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.

SWKC.title: Adolescent Gang Intervention
SWKC.description: The incidence of gangs (particularly in the Los Angeles area),  gang interventions, and policies developed to address the growing  gang situation.

SWKC.title: Special Problems
SWKC.description: Supervised, individual studies. No more than one registration permitted. Enrollment by petition only.

SWKC.title: Community Experience in Juvenile Justice Environments
SWKC.description: Provides in-class and on-site community experiences to increase knowledge and understanding of youth experience in a range of social environments focused on juvenile justice.

SWKC.title: Human Behavior and the Social Environment
SWKC.description: The person-in-environment, bio-psycho-social perspective is the lens through which theories of personality, family, group, organization, community, culture and their interactions are explored. (Duplicates credit in SOWK 503 and SOWK 505)

SWKC.title: Professional Self-Care in Integrative Social Work Practice
SWKC.description: Focuses on the value, examination and integration of professional self-care, wellness and resilience strategies into ethical and professional integrative social work practice.

SWKC.title: Foundations of Integrative Social Work Practice I
SWKC.description: Principles underlying social work practice with emphasis on rapport building, engagement, assessment and contracting individuals, families and groups though a social change framework.

SWKC.title: Applied Learning in Practicum Education I
SWKC.description: Supervised beginning generalist practicum seminar and placement to develop practice skills in working with individuals, families, groups, communities and/or organizations.

SWKC.title: Social Work Perspectives on Contemporary Challenges in Educa
SWKC.description: Provides a holistic understanding of the current issues students and their families must confront. Explores interventions grounded in evidence, best practice models, strength-based and asset-driven.

SWKC.title: Research and Evaluation in Integrative Social Work Practice
SWKC.description: Critical analysis and application of empirical evidence and research methods to assess client strengths and needs and to evaluate and improve integrative social work practice.

SWKC.title: Social Work Practice in School Settings
SWKC.description: Based on ecosystems perspectives, this course examines policies, theories and principles for social work practice in school settings.

SWKC.title: Social Work in Public Child Welfare Settings
SWKC.description: Provides tools to enhance the practitioner's repsonse ot the  special challenges (substance abuse, HIV/AIDS, domestic violence)  in public child welfare.

SWKC.title: Practice and Policy with Children and Families  Across Settings
SWKC.description: Provides context and preparation for integrative social work practitioners on organizational and policy practice, and leadership in communities and systems serving children, youth and families.

SWKC.title: Self-Awareness and Intercultural Humility in  Social Work
SWKC.description: Critical exploration of sociocultural context and one's own  values/assumptions/biases to enhance intercultural humility in  social work.

SWKC.title: Advanced Practice in Integrated Health and Mental Health
SWKC.description: Advanced micro, mezzo and macro practice skills for the implementation of interventions in integrated, health and mental health care settings with individuals, families and groups.

SWKC.title: Clinical Psychopharmacology for Social Workers
SWKC.description: Understanding major psychoactive drugs used in treatment of psychological and behavioral disorders in behavioral and primary care medical settings. Theoretical/practical approaches to treatment are examined.

SWKC.title: Applied Learning In Practicum Education III
SWKC.description: Supervised practicum seminar and placement to develop practice skills in working with individuals, families, groups, communities and/or organizations.

SWKC.title: Theories of Human Behavior in the Contexts of Social Environments
SWKC.description: A focus on human behavior in interaction with the social environment; major paradigms including general systems theory, ego psychology, and role theories are examined.

SWKC.title: Explanatory Theories for Larger Social Systems
SWKC.description: Theories of organizational and community behavior are examined in relation to their influence on the development of social services.

SWKC.title: Introductory Social Work Statistics
SWKC.description: Foundation course covering univariate and bivariate descriptive    and inferential statistics. Required lab covering basic computer   skills and utilization of statistical software.

SWKC.title: Social Work Research Methods I
SWKC.description: Models of research, the ;nature of inquiry, and the research process including problem formulation, measurement, designs, sampling and data sources. Doctoral standing required.

SWKC.title: Advanced Multivariate Statistics
SWKC.description: Introduction to single equation statistical modeling using limited  dependent variables (categorical and ordered categorical).   Methods are drawn from statistics and econometrics.

SWKC.title: Research
SWKC.description: Research leading to the doctorate. Maximum units which may be applied to the degree to be determined by the department. Graded CR/NC.
